p: Furthermore, the WHO and the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) survey revealed that 76.5% of critically ill COVID-19 patients are overweight and over 60% of patients under intensive care are either overweight or morbidly obese. Again, obesity can increase inflammation state and pressure on the lung; also, patients with obesity who require intensive care present challenges in management as it is more difficult to obtain diagnostic imaging, patients are more difficult to intubate, and they may not do well when prone.
